dialogues.text: lies on the ground, unconscious.  Glass scattered all aro

dialogues.text: We'll call 911.  Look around Alex.  We broke in, smashed the t.v., no one's going to believe what happened here! Alex glances around.  The room is a mess.  All the outlet now she notices that everything electronic...t.v., clock, of them have exploded open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you now.  I don't know what the fuck just happened, but it did. Now let's get the hell out of here. Alex slowly rises, reluctant to leave Laurie's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My house.  I want to try something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex and Nick pull up, the streetlights BUZZ on and of it's still daylight.  This doesn't escape Nick's notice. Alex parks the car and the two of them jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick leads Alex to a cellar door and down inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rear the doorway is an old, paint-caked fuse box.  Nick p begins unscrewing fuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking any chances. Nick steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'm going inside.  If I'm not back out in, say, two minutes, you get the hell out of here. Alex nods.  She lifts her digital watch up and sets her t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet you by the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex sits on the hood of the Skylark watching the streetl wary eye.  She glances at her watch.  About a minute and elapsed and... Here's Nick now, carrying a lap-top computer and a modem sets the equipment in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to find a pay-phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sets up his lab-top inside the phone booth as Alex w up the modem to the phone receiver and turns the machine

dialogues.speaker: THE SMALL SCREEN
dialogues.text: warms up, and in black and white, we see the same FRACTAL the lap-top and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just the cable system.  It's in the phone system as well, the electronic net.  It's everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, what is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it is alive in a way...some sort of electronic intelligence.  It's like a computer virus that developed a personality or something.  It's self-replicating...it mimics life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the fractals? Nick nods.  He grabs his skateboard out of the back seat curb, spinning a wheel with his finger.  He stares at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's growing.  Getting stronger. Maybe it's only localized now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching his drift)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but then it hits the relay stations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  And then communication satellites, and then anywhere. Alex looks up into the sky despite herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disbelief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stop it from getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a break, Alex.  What are we going to tell them?  Excuse me, officer, but there's some sort of electronic monster loose in the phone lines.  I'd think twice about calling any of those 976 numbers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where do we go?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Alex stalks off a few paces.  Thinking.  Thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They made ARCADE.  It's still a game, right?  It thinks like a game.  Maybe it still has to play by the rules. Someone had to program it in the first place, didn't they?. At this, Nick perks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean we learn the rules...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And beat it at it's own game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize that in order to do that, we'd actually have to play the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid you'd say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SLIP-STREAM compound comprises a cluster of mirrored, antiseptic-looking buildings.  Carefully maintained green compound, dotted with perfectly positioned trees.  The wh greenery included, seems prefabricated and sterile.  We m camera, sweeping in and dropping low, across the main con stone steps to the main lobby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Nick are moving across the lobby.  Nick is still skateboard.  The two of them look extremely out of place, rest of the people bustling around them are "dressed for THEIR P.O.V. as they approach a prefab RECEPTIONIST sitting behind and The guy's smile is so perfect he must've had it tattooed of those obnoxious phone/headsets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to see Mr. Difford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  And do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it's important and if you'd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but if you don't have an appointment, I won't be able to help you. If you'd like, you can call his office from our courtesy phone outside and schedule one ... Nick reaches across the desk and snags the receptionist b jerking him forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Difford's not out here it one minute we're calling the news and informing them that your fucking games are whispering in our ears and telling us to commit suicide. I'm talking public relations nightmare here, buddy.  Satanism, virgin sacrifices, backward messages, the whole bit. The receptionist glances at Alex who puts on a stern face Nick releases his grip.  The receptionist smooths out his smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment please... (punches in extension)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, would you be kind enough to tell Mr. Difford that we have a situation in the lobby which requires his immediate attention? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-you. The receptionist clasps his hands together and looks back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Difford will be right with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why thank-you. Alex and Nick move away from the reception desk, having c scene.  The rest of the VISITORS watch them with curiosit

dialogues.text: Virgin sacrifices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drives 'em crazy every time. Nick casts his eyes over the walls where graphics from va games are displayed.  He stops on one display in particul sorts featuring the haunting face of ARCADE.

dialogues.speaker: BING
dialogues.text: Alex and Nick turn at the sound, just in time to see Diff elevator and briskly making his way towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Alex, how are we today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know it was us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security camera. (points to one)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulled your files before I came down. Be careful what you say, kids ... I know where you live. Difford laughs and claps Nick on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what seems to be the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the game, ARCADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gotta be the understatement of the century.  It's killing people. Beat.  Difford looks from Alex to Nick, and back again. H from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is a joke, I'm not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither are we.  Something's wrong with the game, Mr. Difford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we take this into my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Difford closes the doors behind him.  He stares and Alex moment, assessing, calculating risks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something wrong with ARCADE. The game's alive somehow... At this Difford breaks into a smile.  Nick sees this and save the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Alex is trying to say is that it "seems" like it's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freezing her with a stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not getting very far into the levels and we kind of thought maybe we could talk to a programmer, learn some tricks and stuff... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you don't want us kids running around school saying your game's too hard, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what this is all about? Tricks? Sure, I'd be happy to introduce you to ARCADE's programmer. Alex has caught on.  She shuts up for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, I'll take you down to our R&D labs right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly what you'd expect.  The lab is hopelessly cluttere whirlwind had swept inside and thrown everything helter-s leads Nick and Alex inside. A MAN sets in front of a stack on monitors.  One his head instrument...sort of an extension of the stereoscopic gog lab-coat and a SLIP-STREAM I.D. badge, but aside from tha is unkempt.  Kind of your 60s drop-out look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of our newest projects. We're trying to get rid of joy-sticks altogether ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Air-Force is working on the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... He moves his head this way and that...

dialogues.speaker: THE MONITORS
dialogues.text: A computer-animated TURTLE is crawling across the screen. "TIME'S UP" flash over.  The turtle flips onto it's back hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearing his throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albert... ALBERT turns around in his seat and pulls off the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Nick and Alex.  They'd like to talk to you about ARCADE.  Maybe you can give them a few programmer's secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nick and Alex)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I leave you in capable hands. Difford exits.  Nick points to the helmet in Albert's han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that thing work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting there.  It's more sensitive than a joy-stick.  Your video-character can respond as fast as you can. (standing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having some problems with ARCADE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tough game.  Hard to pin that bastard down.  Keeps on changing the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We vere thinking there might be tricks. You know, surprises that you'd worked into the game...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Every game's got 'em.  I'll start with the schematics.  I can print these up if you want. Albert moves back to the wall of monitors, then reaches f disk and inserts it into a nearby drive.  He taps a few b BINGO...

dialogues.speaker: SCHEMATICS
dialogues.text: of each world/level within the ARCADE game appear on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got your ten levels, right? Here they are...  Each level has an exit, only remember, the exits aren't always what they seem. (points to each one)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First one's The Blood Red Sky, then you've got The Blue Desert, Tower of Ghosts, Kingdom of the Blind...  On each world you have to find a golden key and you've only got so much time to do it in.  If you're too late, The Screamer comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you stop The Screamer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.  He gets you and you're dead. It's like time catching up with you, you know?  Like Fate.  Each level you get progressively less time to complete.  First half of the game takes place in the Wild Lands.  Then you reach Level 6, and that's the Sea of Darkness.  There's a two-headed Boatman that'll take you across if you answer his riddle right.  If you don't... He motions cutting a knife across his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the riddle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell you, then it's no fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me the fucking riddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...it involves a paradox.  You have to trick The Boatman. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all the while, you also have to watch your strength.  You can build that back up by catching FIREFLIES...the little glowing guys... Albert hits some keys again and Levels One through Six di they're replaced by Seven through Ten. Only instead of a Level Eleven, there's only a question matc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next half of the game takes place in ARCADE's brain, The City of Truth. It's urban scenarios, lots of metal and concrete. Screamer comes faster here.  On Level Four you can get a free life if you wait until the last possible second before exiting that world.  Gotta time it right though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the question mark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level Ten.  That's where you've got to unlock ARCADE's heart using the keys you've found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question.  See, that's where the fun comes in.  ARCADE changes it every time. He's a machine without a soul. Once you give him a soul, he stops being a threat. Alex looks dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how can it change every time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the game's logic core.  We actually patterned it after human brainwaves.  I mean, there's a personality in there. That's what makes it so incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're veering into classified info here, but I'll tell you that it involved a donor.  He was dead of course, so it's not like anything unethical was happening. At this, a chill runs down Alex's spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, brain-dead anyway.  Coma patient. It's really not all that important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The donor.  Maybe he's alive inside the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe you've been taking too many drugs. Nick glances at the helmet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you play ARCADE with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, technically "yes", but this is only the prototype. Nick nods and smiles, offering his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Albert.  Think you could print up those schematics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Albert moves back to the computer console.  Meanwhile, Ni aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go outside, get your car, and meet me out front with the engine running. And make it quick, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that helmet.  If we're going to play ARCADE, I want every advantage possible.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE LAB,
dialogues.text: Albert is oblivious to their conversation. Alex backs towards the lab doors, turns, and opens them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex makes her way quickly down the hall, turning a corne SECURITY GUARD.  She waves at him, her smile fading as so passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. R&D LAB - DAY Albert is just pulling the last printed copy of the schem laser printer.  He turns and hands them to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.  Happy hunting. Nick takes the schematics and tucks them inside his jacke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again. And with that, Nick pulls back his fist and punches Alber face. Albert goes down, more stunned than hurt, and Nick spring He scoops up the CyberHelmet in his free hand, kicks open tosses his skateboard into the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick leaps on the board and starts pumping his foot like up speed like mad... He's racing down the hallway, maneuvering between startle here comes a MAN with a mail cart... WHOOSH!  Nick zips by him.  And now an ALARM is ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick comes SCREECHING around the corner, narrowly missing two SECURITY GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him! But Nick's already past them.  He puts his foot down agai more momentum...

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARDS
dialogues.text: are after him now, CHARGING down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD,
dialogues.text: A set of double doors labeled "EMERGENCY EXIT" blocks his Nick spins out, sweeping the back of the board forward an stop just before the doors.  He kicks the board up into h and... WHAM!  He hits the doors running.  Now the FIRE ALARM is addition to the other alarm.  A VOICE is squawking over t a hell of a racket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on P.A.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECURITY BREACH IN R&D.  SUBJECT HEADING TOWARDS EASTERN EXIT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is charging down the stairs four and a time...  One Now he's reached ground floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!  Nick tumbles out of the stairwell only to see a tr heading straight for him. Nick drops his board to the ground and heads right, pumpi One of the GUARDS leaps at him and... ...misses by a foot or so, CRASHING to the tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: SCREECHES to another stop, TWISTS, and starts pumping dow hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick plows into the loading area like a bullet, whipping boxes and lumbering forklifts.  A few WORKERS attempt to he's moving too fast.
